description.p: Through training and underhanded tactics you have learned to fight those who use the Arcane.
You are proficent in Arcana and can add double your proficiency modifier to skill checks with it.

Starting at 3rd level, you don’t need advantage on the attack roll to use your Sneak Attack against a creature if you are at least 60 feet from it. All the other rules for Sneak Attack still apply to you.

sheet.description: You don’t need advantage on the attack roll to use your Sneak Attack against a creature if you are at least 60 feet from it. All the other rules for Sneak Attack still apply to you.

description.p: At 9th level, your evasion skills improve. Whenever you would be forced to make a saving throw for any magical area effect to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

sheet.description: Whenever you would be forced to make a saving throw for any magical area effect to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

description.p: Beginning at 13th level you become adept at stopping spellcasters. As a reaction to seeing a spell cast by an enemy you can make an attack at disadvantage towards that creature. If it hits the target must make a concentration check equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier. On failure the spellcast is interrupted and fails to cast.

sheet.description: As a reaction to seeing a spell cast by an enemy you can make an attack at disadvantage towards that creature. If it hits the target must make a concentration check (DC {{quick-shot:dc}}). On failure the spellcast is interrupted and fails to cast.

description.p: Starting at 17th level, once per round, whenever you hit a creature with an attack and they have a magical effect or spell active on itself or are concentrating on a spell, your sneak attack damage is maximized. When maximized in this way your sneak attack cannot crit.
